result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan N Portillo

defendant.name: Portillo, Jonathan N
defendant.address: 3619 West Mount Vernon Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan N Portillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder appeared by video for Jonathan N Portillo. Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant at HOC and not produced. Defense received discovery and offer and requested one more status conference. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to access and view any and all electronic discovery materials.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Letter to Judge Grayson from Attorney Cotton.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Jonathan N Portillo.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and requested more time for review. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder appeared by video for Jonathan N Portillo.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan N Portillo appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
